v.v: A good name is better than costly perfume,
It is better to go to a house of mourning
Grief is better than laughter,
The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning,
It is better to listen to the rebuke of the wise
For like the crackling of thorns burning under a pot,
Extortion certainly makes a wise man foolish,
Better is the end of a matter than the beginning;
Do not be quick to anger in your spirit,
Do not say, “Why were the days of old better than these?”
Wisdom, like an inheritance, is good.
For wisdom provides protection as money can provide protection,
Consider the deeds of God:
When times are good, live happily in that good,
I have seen many things in my meaningless days.
Do not be self-righteous,
Do not be too wicked or foolish.
It is good that you should take hold of this wisdom,
Wisdom is powerful in the wise man,
There is not a righteous man on earth
Do not listen to every word that is spoken,
Similarly, you know yourself that in your own heart
All this have I proven by wisdom. I said,
Wisdom is far off and very deep.
I turned my heart to learn and examine
I found that more bitter than death is any woman
“Consider what I have discovered,” says the Teacher. “I have been adding one discovery to another in order to find an explanation of reality.
This is what I am still looking for, but I have not found it. I did find one righteous man among a thousand, but a woman among all those I did not find.
I have discovered only this: That God created humanity upright, but they have gone away looking for many difficulties.”

v: and the day of death is better than the day of birth.
than to a house of feasting,
for mourning comes to all people at the end of life,
so living people must take this to heart.
for after sadness of face comes gladness of heart.
but the heart of fools is in the house of feasting.
than to listen to the song of fools.
so also is the laughter of fools.
This, too, is vapor.
and a bribe corrupts the heart.
and the people patient in spirit are better than the proud in spirit.
for anger resides in the hearts of fools.
For it is not because of wisdom that you ask this question.
It benefits those who see the sun.
but the advantage of knowledge is that wisdom gives life to whoever has it.
Who can straighten out anything he has made crooked?
but when times are bad, consider this:
God has allowed both to exist side by side.
For this reason, no one will find out anything that is coming after him.
There are righteous people who perish in spite of their righteousness,
and there are wicked people who live a long life in spite of their evil.
wise in your own eyes.
Why should you destroy yourself?
Why should you die before your time?
and that you should not let go of righteousness.
For the person who fears God will meet all his obligations.
more than ten rulers in a city.
who does good and never sins.
because you might hear your servant curse you.
you have often cursed others.
“I will be wise,”
but it was more than I could be.
Who can find it?
and seek wisdom and the explanations of reality,
and to understand that evil is stupid
and that folly is madness.
whose heart is full of snares and nets,
and whose hands are chains.
Whoever pleases God will escape from her,
but the sinner will be taken by her.
